CALL.description:
Calls a subroutine.

Sets value of the Program Counter to address of the next instruction and pushes it onto the stack.

Least significant byte is pushed first and the most significant byte is pushed second.

After that the Program Counter is updated so it points to a subroutine.

**This instruction is a placeholder. It get's replaced by either ACALL or LCALL, whichever is more fitting.**

ACALL.description:
Calls a subroutine within a 2K block of memory.

Sets value of the Program Counter to address of the next instruction and pushes it onto the stack.

Least significant byte is pushed first and the most significant byte is pushed second.

After that a least significant byte of the Program Counter replaced by the second byte of the ACALL instruction, 

and the three least significant bits (0-2) of the most significant byte of PC with bits indicating a page.

Other bits of the most significant byte of the Program Counter are unchanged.

LCALL.description:
Calls a subroutine.

Sets value of the Program Counter to address of the next instruction and pushes it onto the stack.

Least significant byte is pushed first and the most significant byte is pushed second.

After that the Program Counter is updated so it points to a subroutine.

RET.description:
Return from a subroutine called by LCALL or ACALL.

Pops two bytes off the stack and stores them in the Program Counter.

Least significant byte is popped first.

RETI.description:
Enables interrupts of lower or equal priority to the one the program is returning from, 

and then pops two bytes off the stack and stores them in the Program Counter.

Least significant byte is popped first.

AJMP.description:
Jump to an address within a 2K block of memory.

A least significant byte of the Program Counter replaced by the second byte of the instruction, 

and the three least significant bits (0-2) of PC with bits indicating a page.

Other bits of the most significant byte of the Program Counter are unchanged.

LJMP.description:
Jumps to a specified address.
Sets a value of the Program Counter to a provided address.

SJMP.description:
Jump to a relative address.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

Result of that addition is stored back in the Program Counter.

JMP.description:
If @A+DPTR is a provided operand jumps to an address that is a sum of values of the Accumulator and DPTR.

Otherwise it gets replaced by AJMP, LJMP, or SJMP instructions.

CJNE.detail: Compare and jump if not equal
CJNE.description:
Jumps to a relative address if values of two operands are not equal, otherwise program continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

affected_flags.when_set: value of a first operand is less than value of a second operand

DJNZ.detail: Decrement and jump if not zero
DJNZ.description:
Decrements value of an operand by 1.

If the resulting value is not equal zero jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JB.description:
If a provided bit is set (1), jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JBC.detail: Jump if bit set and clear it
JBC.description:
If a provided bit is set, clears that bit and jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JC.description:
If the Carry flag is set, jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JNC.description:
If the Carry flag is not set, jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JNB.description:
If a provided bit is not set, jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JZ.description:
If a value of the Accumulator equals zero, jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

JNZ.detail: Jump if Accumulator is not zero
JNZ.description:
If a value of the Accumulator is not equal zero, jumps to a relative address, otherwise continues to the next instruction.

Provided address is treated as an signed byte (-128 to 127) and is added to the Program Counter.

NOP.description: Does nothing for a single cycle
